column1: Janet's ducks lay 16 eggs a day. Janet consumes three pieces each morning as part of her breakfast and uses four pieces each day to bake muffins for her friends. Sell ​​the rest on the market at a price of $2 each. How much does she get in the market every day?
To create a robe, you will need two turns of blue fiber and half of that of white fiber. How many volumes do I need in total?

Josh decides to try his hand at buying and selling real estate. He bought the house for $80,000 and spent $50,000 renovating it. As a result, the price of the house increased by 150%. What is Josh's profit?
James decided to run three sprints each time, three times a week. He runs 60 meters per sprint. How many meters will James run in a week?

Every day, Wendy feeds her chickens three cups of a mix of seeds, mealworms, and vegetables to keep them healthy. The chickens are fed in three parts. Feed 15 cups of feed per chicken in the morning. Feed another 25 cups in the afternoon. If Wendy's total number of chickens is 20, how many cups should she feed on the third feeding?

Kyler went to the store to buy glasses for his new apartment. Glasses cost $5 each, but if you buy one, you can buy the second for 60% of the original price. Kyler wants to buy 16 glasses. How much will the total cost be?

Toulouse has twice as many sheep as Charleston. Charleston has four times as many sheep as Seattle. If Seattle has 20 sheep, what is the total number of sheep owned by Toulouse, Charleston, and Seattle?

Kara has downloaded a 200 gigabyte file and is about to download it. Normally, the download speed is 2 gigabytes per minute, but after 40% of the download progresses, Windows restarts for 20 minutes to install the update. After that, Kara had to start the download all over again. How long does it take to download the file?

After driving for three hours at 60 miles per hour, John turns back because he realizes he has left something very important at home. He tries to return to his home within four hours, but is stuck in heavy traffic for the first two hours. I spent the next 30 minutes driving at 30 mph, then 80 mph heading home. How many miles will John be from his home when four hours have passed?
Eliza's hourly rate is $10 for the first 40 hours of the week. Overtime will be paid at 1.2 times the regular salary. If Eliza worked 45 hours this week, how much salary would she receive?

The new program was downloaded 60 times in the first month. Downloads tripled in the second month, but dropped by 30% in the third month. In total, how many times have you downloaded the program over the past 3 months?

Tula went to the bakery and bought various pastries. I purchased 36 donuts costing $68 per 12, 24 mini cupcakes costing $80 per 12, and 72 mini cheesecakes costing $55 per 12. How much was the total amount?

Carlos is trying to plant a lemon tree. Lemon trees cost $90 to plant. It produces seven lemons each year and sells for $1.50 each. It costs $3 per year to water and fertilize the tree. How many years will it take for Carlos to start making money from his lemon trees?

Melanie is a door-to-door salesperson. Of the vacuum cleaners on sale, the green house sold one-third, the red house sold two, and the orange house sold half of the remaining vacuum cleaners. If Melanie has 5 vacuum cleaners left, how many did she have at the time the sale started?
In a dance class of 20 students, 20% are learning contemporary dance, 25% are learning jazz dance, and the rest are learning hip hop dance. What percentage of all students are learning hip hop dance?

A merchant is trying to choose between two purchasing plans: jewelry worth $5,000 and electronics worth $8,000. According to estimates by merchant financial advisors, over the next same month, jewelry prices will rise by 2.5% and electronics prices by 1.2%. If you choose a purchasing plan that maximizes your profit at the end of this month, how much profit will you make?
Two trains leave San Rafael at the same time. Both travel 80 miles in a westerly direction. The next day we headed north for 150 miles. How many miles did each train travel in two days?
Jill receives $20 an hour as a teacher and $30 an hour as a cheerleading coach. If Jill works 50 weeks a year, 35 hours a week as a teacher and 15 hours a week as a coach, what is her annual salary?
Claire makes a three-egg omelet for breakfast every morning. How many eggs will Claire eat in 4 weeks?

Marissa goes on a 12-mile hike. It took me an hour to walk the first 4 miles, and another hour to walk the next 2 miles. If I want to walk at an average speed of 4 miles per hour, how fast (in miles per hour) must I walk the remaining distance?

You have 10 liters of orange juice, two-thirds of which is water. I am about to add this to a 15 liter pineapple drink that is 3/5 water. I spilled 1 liter of orange juice while pouring it. How much of the remaining 24 liters is water?

Raymond and Samantha are cousins. Raymond was born six years earlier than Samantha. Raymond had a son when he was 23 years old. If Samantha is now 31 years old, how many years ago was Raymond's son born?

Billy sells DVDs. He has 8 customers on Tuesday. His first three customers will each purchase one DVD. His two next day customers each purchased two DVDs. The last 3 customers of will not purchase the DVD. How many DVDs did Billy sell on Tuesday?
A candle melts two centimeters for every hour it burns. How many centimeters will a candle that burns from 1:00 pm to 5:00 pm be shorter?
Kyle bought a best-selling book last year for $19.50. 25% lower than the original price. What is the original price of this book?

Marie ordered a chicken dish for $12, 5 cartons of milk for $3 each, 4 apples for $1.50 each, and several boxes of pizza. Marie paid $50 in total. How many boxes of pizza did Marie order if she said each box of pizza costs $8.50?

Mishka bought three pairs of shorts, three pairs of long pants, and three pairs of shoes. Her shorts cost $16.50 each. Long pants were $22.50 a pair and shoes were $42 a pair. How much did you spend on all clothing?
Cynthia eats a serving of ice cream every night. She bought a carton of ice cream with 15 servings at $4 per carton. How much will she spend on ice cream after 60 days?

Henry makes two stops during his 60-mile bicycle journey. He first ran 20 miles and then stopped. The second stop was 15 miles before the end of the trip. How many miles apart are the first and second locations?

Gloria is shoe shopping and finds a pair of boots that fit her budget. But she has to choose between her boots and two pairs of high heels, which together cost $5 less than the boots. If one pair of heels costs $33 and the other pair costs twice that much, how much do the boots cost?
The age ratio of Darrell and Allen is 7:11. If their combined ages are now 162, calculate how old Allen will be in 10 years.

Gunter is trying to count the jelly beans in the jar. He asks his friend how many bottles he thinks are in it. Some people say 80. The other person answers 20 more than the first person's half. The third person says it's 25% more than the first person's answer. What is the average value of the three people's predictions?
John looks after 10 dogs. For each dog, you need to spend 30 minutes a day walking and caring for each one. How many hours a week does he look after the dog?
Gretchen has 110 coins. There are 30 more gold coins than silver coins. How many gold coins does Gretchen have?
Siobhan has two fewer gems than Aaron. Aaron has 5 more gems than Raymond. If Raymond has 40 jewels, how many jewels does Siobhan have?
Mike plays table tennis for 40 minutes. In the first 20 minutes, he scores 4 points. In the next 20 minutes, he scored 25% more points. How many points did he score in total?
Terry eats two yogurts a day. Yogurt is currently on sale for 4 for $5. How much does he spend on 30 days worth of yogurt?

John plans to sell all his toys and use the money to buy a video game. He has 13 Lego sets that he sells for $15 each. He ended up buying eight $20 video games and had $5 left over. How many Lego sets does he currently have?
John runs 60 miles a week. He runs three days a week. He runs three hours the first day and half the other two days. How fast is he running?

Dana can run four times faster than she can on foot, but can skip at half the speed she runs. If she can skip at a speed of 3 miles an hour, if she runs 1/3 of the time and walks 2/3 of the time, how many kilometers will she advance in 6 hours?
Brandon's iPhone is four times older than Ben's iPhone. Ben's iPhone is twice as old as Susie's iPhone. If Susie's iPhone is one year old, how old is Brandon's iPhone?

That great dragon, Perg, sat atop Mount Farbo and breathed fire at everything within 1000 feet. Polly was able to throw a golden spear 400 feet, the only known weapon capable of whittling down dragons. That distance is enough for the dragon's flame to reach. However, if Polly had the sapphire gem, he could throw his spear three times farther than without. If he had the gem, how far away from the dragon's fire range could Polly hit the dragon with the golden spear?

Grandma Jones baked five apple pies for the firefighters' luncheon. She cut each pie into eight pieces and placed the five pieces on the buffet table for guests to take for themselves. By the end of the night, 14 pies remained after each guest took and ate their pie. How many pies did the guests eat?

According to nutritional information, one bag of potato chips has 250 calories per serving. If your daily calorie goal is 2000 and you are already consuming 1800 calories, how many grams of potato chips can you eat in a 300g bag of 5 servings?

Charlie wants to sell beeswax. For each pound of beeswax, he can make 10 taper candles. Supplies cost $10.00 per pound of beeswax and wick. If he sells each candle for $2.00 each, what is his net profit from making and selling 20 candles?

Meredith is a freelance blogger whose day job is to write about health topics and submit daily submissions to clients. Her blog posts take an average of four hours to research and write. Last week, on Monday she wrote 5 articles, and on Tuesday she wrote 2/5 times as many articles as on Monday. On Wednesday, she wrote twice as many articles as she wrote on Tuesday. Calculate the total number of hours she spent writing her article over the three days.

Candice placed 80 post-it notes in her bag before heading to work at the coffee shop. On her way, she stopped at a store and bought a pack of post-it notes. At her workplace, she placed Post-it notes on each of 220 different coffee cups. If she had 23 post-it notes left, how many post-it notes were in the pack she purchased?
John buys twice as many red ties as blue ties. Red ties cost 50% more than blue ties. He spent $200 on blue ties that cost $40 each. How much did he spend on the tie?
Tracy was using four-foot lengths of wire to support tomato plants in her garden. The wire is now cut into 6 inch lengths. How many wires did she get?
Richard lives in a 15-story apartment building. There are eight rooms on each floor, and three quarters of the building is occupied. How many unoccupied rooms are there in the building?
Lloyd has an egg farm. His chickens produce 252 eggs a day, which he sells for $2 a dozen. How many eggs can Lloyd produce per week?
Tom's boat can travel 10 miles in an hour. He sails from 1 to 4 p.m. He then makes his way home at 6 miles per hour. How long will it be before he returns?

Uriah's bookbag is becoming too heavy for him. He needs 15 pounds removed from the bottom. His comic books are 1/4 pound each and his toys are 1/2 pound each. If he removes 30 comic books, how many toys does he need to remove?

Mechanics charge different rates for repairing trucks and cars. The mechanic charges $60 to repair each truck tire and $40 to repair each car tire. On Thursday, mechanics will repair six truck tires and four car tires. On Friday, mechanics repaired 12 tires, but not the truck tires. How much more did the mechanic make on the day he made more money?

The Doubtfire sisters are driving home with seven kittens they adopted from a local shelter when their mother calls to tell them that two of their cats have given birth to kittens. She says her first cat, Patchy, gave birth to three times as many kittens as she adopted, and another cat, Trixie, gave birth to 12 kittens. How many kittens does the Doubtfire family have now?
Jane has 30 candies. Jane eats two of the candies. With the remaining candy, Jane wants to put two candies in one bag to make a set. How many bags can Jane prepare?
Peter is going to the movies this week. He always buys $7 tickets and $7 popcorn. If he has $42 for the week, how many times can he go to the movies?

Wooden bridges cannot withstand more than 5000 pounds. A delivery truck is loaded with 33 identical boxes of 15 pounds each and is about to cross a bridge. The combined weight of the driver and empty truck is 3755 pounds. What is the maximum number of boxes that can be loaded onto a truck without exceeding the bridge weight limit?

Stephen ordered groceries online. His final bill was $40.00. Since I went through a delivery company, they added a 25% commission to the final total and charged me a $3.00 delivery fee. Stephen also added a $4.00 tip. After adding the additional fees, what is the final cost of Stephen's grocery order?
A raspberry bush has six clusters of 20 berries each and 67 individual berries. How many raspberries are there in total?
The basket contains 25 oranges, one spoiled, 20% still green, two sour, and the rest in good condition. How many oranges are in good condition?
Janet buys a brooch for her daughter. She paid $500 for the materials to make it and then $800 for a jeweler to make it. She then insured it for 10%. How much did she pay?

If Marcy works for the same company for 40 years, she will receive a pension of $50,000 a year. After 20 years, she will be able to receive a 5% annual pension. If she quits after 30 years, how much will her pension be?

Arena subscribes to a streaming service that costs $140 a month. If she pays for her first six months and the streaming service offers her a 10% discount for the next six months, calculate how much she paid the streaming service by the end of the year.

Sophia is thinking of taking a road trip and wants to know how far she can go on one tank of gas. She has driven 100 miles since she last filled her tank and needed to put in 4 gallons to fill it up again. The car owner's manual says the tank holds 12 gallons of gas. How many miles can Sofia go on one tank of gas?
Jim watches TV for two hours, then goes to bed and reads for half that time. Do this three times a week. How many hours does he spend watching TV and reading in 4 weeks?

Four schools are competing in a basketball tournament. Each school has a girls basketball team and a boys basketball team participating, with five players on each team. Each school also has one coach participate. How many people are participating in all schools?

A treasure hunter finds a buried chest of treasure filled with jewels. There were 175 diamonds, 35 fewer rubies, and twice as many emeralds as rubies. How many jewels were there in total in the chest of drawers?
Dr. Wertz's school has twice as many boys as girls. If there are 60 girls and 1 teacher and 5 students, how many teachers are there?
Bailey initially has some money. She then receives a weekly allowance of $5 for eight weeks. If she had $100 total at the end of the 8 weeks, how much did Bailey have at the beginning?
Judy teaches 5 dance classes each day during the week and 8 classes on Saturdays. If there are 15 students in each class and she charges each person $15, how much does she earn per week?

Kellyanne has two recipes to prepare her food, the first has 20 instructions and the second has twice as many instructions as the first recipe. How many instructions does Kellyanne have to read to prepare the two dishes?
Tommy sells brownies for $3 a slice and cheesecake for $4 to raise money for his charity. How much money will Tommy collect if he sells 43 brownies and 23 cheesecakes?
Sheila purchased five cell phones for $150 each in three payments. Each unit will be charged 2% interest. How much will Sheila pay each month for three months?

Artie has a flower stand at the farmers market. He sells three types of flowers: marigolds, petunias, and begonias. Marigolds cost $2.74 per pot, petunias cost $1.87 per pot, and begonias cost $2.12 per pot. Since Artie doesn't have change today, he decides to price everything to the nearest dollar. If Artie sells 12 pots of marigolds, 9 pots of petunias, and 17 pots of begonias, how much can he sell?

Luke is spending time on the beach building sandcastles. He eventually realizes that each level of the sandcastle is half the size of the level below it. If he builds a four-story sandcastle and the top floor is 16 square feet, what is the average size of each level?

Cecilia just bought a new puppy. According to her vet, she needs to feed the puppy one cup of dog food every day for the first 180 days. Then, you should feed your dog 2 cups of dog food for the rest of his life. If one bag of dog food contains 110 cups, how many bags of dog food will Cecilia need during the first year?

If Raymond does half as much laundry as Sarah does, and Sarah does as much laundry as David, then if Sarah does 400 pounds of laundry, how much difference is there between the amount of laundry Raymond and David do?
Vincent's flowers can be purchased in packages of three for $2.50 or in packages of two for $1. How much will you save if you buy 18 flowers at a better price?
John becomes a foster parent to a dog. He takes the dog to the groomer and it costs $100. The groomer offers him a 30% discount for new customers. How much will trimming cost?
Two girls each drank a sixth of 24 liters of water. Then the boy drank 6 liters of water. How many liters of water are left?

Charlie has 10 stickers. He bought 21 stickers at the mall store and received 23 stickers for his birthday. Charlie then gave 9 of them to his sister and used 28 for greeting cards. How many stickers does Charlie have left?
Grace weighs 125 pounds. Alex weighs 2 pounds less than 4 times Grace's weight. What is their total weight in pounds?
Dan plants three rose seedlings. Each rose plant has 25 roses. Each rose has eight thorns. How many thorns are there in total?
The soccer team played 22 games. They won eight more games than they lost. How many times did they win?

Gene is sewing a quilt using souvenir T-shirts. He gets one shirt for every vacation he goes on. Every shirt becomes a block in its own quilt. Each column uses blocks of vacations from different years. He has been going on vacation four times a year since he was 23 years old. He is currently 34 years old. How many quilt blocks are there in total?

Greg has an alarm set to go off three times a day as a reminder. It keeps ringing until Greg turns it off. The alarm went off for the first time today and it went off 4 times. The second time it rang, it rang three times longer than the first time. The third time it rang, it rang half as long as the second time. How many times did the alarm go off in total?

A company pays its employees $600 per month. The company has a policy of increasing the salary of employees who have been with the company for five years by 10% of their initial salary each year. If Sylvie celebrated her fifth year with the company in December of last year, what will be her annual salary after she serves three more years?
Marilyn's first record sold 10 times more than Harald's. If they sold 88,000 tickets together, how many tickets did Harald sell?

Christina is planning a birthday party and requires .75 gift bags for each guest since 1/4 of the attendees will not be attending. She invited 16 friends. Gift bags are $2 each. How much will she end up spending?

Ted the Tyrannosaurus was planning to bring potato salad to the dinosaur picnic. He found that an adult dinosaur would eat 10 pounds of potato salad, and a child would eat half as much as an adult. If Ted wants everyone to have enough to eat, how many pounds of potato salad should he bring to the picnic if 20 adults and 5 children are attending?
Jean has three times as many pets as Marcia. Marcia has two more pets than Cindy. If Cindy has 4 pets, how many pets do the 3 of you have in total?

Emily has four children named Amy, Jackson, Cory, and James. Amy is five years older than Jackson and two years younger than Cory. If James is 10 years old and one year younger than Cory, how old is Jackson?

Lee was once able to run the 400m hurdles two seconds faster than Gerald could run the 400m hurdles. But Gerald changed his diet and his speed improved by 10%. If Lee can run the 400m hurdles in 38 seconds, how many seconds can Gerald run the 400m hurdles after improving his diet?
In my neighborhood, there are 12 fewer pet rabbits than pet dogs and cats combined. If there are 2 cats per dog, and the number of dogs is 60, how many pets are there in total in the neighborhood?
Of the 200 fifth grade students, two-fifths are boys and two-thirds of the girls are in Girl Scouts. How many girls aren't in Girl Scouts?
Harry slept for nine hours last night. His friend James only slept two thirds as much as Harry did. How many more hours did Harry sleep than James?

When Frida makes a sauce with canned tomatoes, the volume is reduced by half. Each 16-ounce tomato can she uses contains three tomatoes. The last batch of tomato sauce contained 32 oz. How many tomatoes did Frida use?

Cars are lined up on the highway. Some of them are running the first 15 minutes of the traffic jam, and the next 20 are running the remaining 15 minutes of the traffic jam. Five cars in the line took the exit to avoid having to drive through traffic. If there were originally 30 cars on the highway, how many cars made it through the first 15 minutes of the traffic jam?

Marie is an avid entertainer. Yesterday she received 18 new potted plants from her favorite nursery. She already has two potted plants in each of the 40 window sills in her large country home. Her enthusiasm grew and she decided to give one potted plant from each window sill to her friends and family tomorrow. How many potted plants will remain in Marie?

Jerome has four friends who come to visit him on certain days. The first friend rang the doorbell 20 times before Jerome opened the door, and the second friend rang it a quarter of the time as Jerome's first friend. The third friend rang the doorbell 10 times more than the fourth friend. If the fourth friend rang the doorbell 60 times, how many times did the doorbell ring?

Solo must read 4 pages of a science textbook, 20 pages of a sociology textbook, 7 pages of a history textbook, and 8 pages of a geography textbook. Solo read 15 pages on Monday. If he has 4 days left to finish reading, how many pages should he read per day on average?

John likes to drink a glass of water with breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Eventually, he also drinks one before going to bed. John does this every weekday, but on the weekends he wants to relax and drinks soda instead at dinner. How many times a week does he drink water?

A fog embankment flowing from the sea covers the city. It takes 10 minutes for every 3 miles of the city to be covered. If a city is 42 miles from the beach to the other end of the land, how many minutes does it take for fog to cover the entire city?
Poppy is solving a 1000 piece jigsaw puzzle. She fits a quarter of the pieces onto the board, and her mother fits the remaining third. How many pieces of the puzzle remain to be fitted?
Kody eats three times as many cookies as Amir does. If Amir eats 5 cookies, how many cookies will they both eat?
John has three boxes. Each box is 5" x 6" x 4". The walls are 1 inch hot. What is the content of all 3 boxes?

Frankie watches TV every night after finishing his homework. On Monday and Tuesday, he watched an hour-long episode of his favorite show each day. On Wednesday, he watched several half-hour episodes. On Thursday, he finished his homework early and watched an hour-long episode and a half-hour show. On a Friday weekend, he stayed up late and watched two one-hour episodes. If he watched 7 hours of TV in total, how many half-hour episodes did he watch on Wednesday?

Henry is making cookies for a local contest. He wants to bake twice as many as he baked last year. Once he finished baking, he realized that he had actually baked 15 more pieces than he thought. He removed 5 of them while taking them out to cool, and now there are 110 cookies in total. How many cookies did Henry bake last year?

Local gas stations sell it for $3.00 a gallon. The app company will give you $.20 cash back for every gallon you fill up at this gas station. If someone buys 10 gallons of gas, how much will the gas bill cost after cashback?

Marcel and Betrice were competing to see who could eat the most fruit rolls, and they spread out as many fruit rolls as they could find. Unfortunately, someone made a mistake and Betrice's was 2 rolls wide and 24 rolls long, while Marcel's was 3 rolls wide and 14 rolls long. Ta. If they ate all the amounts, how much did they eat on average?

Julia's boat started leaking while driving on the lake. Does her boat take in 2 liters of water for every 10 feet she rows toward shore? The shore was 64 seconds away. How much water entered the boat before Julia reached the shore?

The classroom has a whiteboard that is shared by four teachers who take turns using the classroom. Each teacher has two classes a day, and each class uses a whiteboard. If the whiteboard is cleaned 3 times per class, how many times a day is the whiteboard cleaned?
Ryan plants two flowers a day in his garden. If 5 flowers have not grown after 15 days, how many flowers does he have?

Jamal's phone can store 6 times more photos than Brittany's phone. The maximum number of photos that Brittany's phone can store is 50 times the number of birds in Jamal's photo of ducks at the zoo. If Jamal's cell phone can store 1800 photos, how many ducks are there in Jamal's photo of ducks at the zoo?

Sasha notices that the price of lumber has increased by 50% in the few months since she bought some. She has the rest so she decides to sell them. She has 10 2 x 4 x 10 boards that cost $10 each. She also had five 4 x 4 x 10 boards, which she purchased for $16 each. How much profit will she make if she sells everything?

Katie makes her coffee in a 7:13 ratio: a few teaspoons of sugar and a few tablespoons of hot water. If she used a total of 120 teaspoons of sugar and hot water, calculate how many teaspoons of sugar she used.
John buys two pairs of shoes for each of his three children. They cost $60 each. How much did he pay?

Customs officials at the main seaside port are checking two containers of imported cars, each with five cars inside. The next day, more containers were brought in, bringing the total number of vehicles at the port to 30. If every container contained 5 cars, calculate how many containers were imported on the second day.

Adrian's total salary is 30% higher than Lilia's salary. Four years later, his salary has increased and he is earning 40% more than he did four years ago. If Adrian and Lilia's salaries increased at the same time, and Adrian earned $40,000 four years ago, how much total salary would they both receive in four years?
Miguel uses two pads of paper a week for his paintings. If one pad of paper contains 30 sheets, how many sheets of paper does he use each month?

Morissette and Cale were asked to bring some fruit. Morissette brought five apples and eight oranges, while Cale brought twice as many apples and half as many oranges as Morissette. How many fruits do they have in total?

Sadie slept eight hours Monday. The next two days she slept two hours less each time she had to finish her homework. If she sleeps one hour more the rest of the week than on those two days, how many hours has she slept all week?
Rosie runs for 3 hours at a speed of 10 miles per hour. Then run at a speed of 5 miles per hour. How many miles can she run in 7 hours?

Jenny helps her mother in her office. She has a mass of 60 letters that need stamps and a mass of letters that already have stamps on them. She puts stamps on a third of the letters that require stamps. If there are now 30 letters in the already stamped block of letters, how many letters were there in the block when Jenny started her work?

Julia was preparing for a dinner party at her home, intending to treat herself to some stew. She realized she was missing plastic spoons, so she bought a new package of spoons. Later, her husband also bought a package of five new spoons and gave them to Julia. While making the stew, Julia used three spoons to taste the stew. Later, when she went to set the table, there were 12 spoons in total. How many spoons were in the package of spoons that Julia purchased?

Dylan needed chicken sausage and fish sausage in the pantry to make sausage buns. He bought 38 chicken sausages and 6 more fish sausages than chicken sausages. How many sausages did Dylan buy in total?
Since moving to the new school, Amy has made 20 more friends than Lily. If Lily made 50 friends, how many friends did Lily and Abby make together?

Well's mother sells watermelons, peppers, and oranges at a local store. Watermelon costs three times the price of each chili pepper. Oranges are 5 cheaper than watermelons. Dillon sent 4 watermelons, 20 peppers, and 10 oranges to her store. If each chili pepper costs $15, how much will it cost in total?

A hospital sees 500 patients every day. Each patient is seen for an average of 24 minutes. The doctor charges the hospital $150 per hour. The hospital charges patients $200 per hour. How much revenue does the hospital make from these visits?

Nyssa hires 60 temporary employees to play elves at her department store in Santa Village. 1 in 3 elves quit after a child pukes on them. Then the remaining 10 quit after the kid kicks them in the shin. How many elves will remain?
Joseph's expenses for May were $500. In June, he spent $60 less. What was his total expenditure for these two months?

Pam and Fred went to the carnival. Pam has ridden the roller coaster twice and Fred has ridden it four times. After that, we each rode the luge twice. If they each used 6 tickets to ride, how many tickets did they use that day?

On Monday, Walt walked four miles. On Tuesday, he walked six times as many miles as he walked on Monday. The total distance he walked from Monday to Wednesday was 41 miles. How many miles did he walk on Wednesday?
Tom washes four cars a month. If each car wash costs $15, how much do you pay per year?
Brian's friend Bobby has 5 fewer games than 3 times the number of games Brian has. If Brian has 20 video games and loses 5 just before the comparison, how many games does Bobby have?
There are 27 unicorns left in the world. A third of this is in the Scottish Highlands. Two-thirds of Scottish unicorns are female. How many female Scottish unicorns are there?

Laurie orders two sandwiches for $7.50 each, two bags of potato chips for $1.50 each, and two cookies for $1.00 each to be delivered. A 20% delivery fee will be added to the bill, and she would like to tip $5.00. How much does a delivery order cost?

Mark took a test with 75 questions yesterday. He completed the test at a speed of 5 questions per hour. Today he took a test with 100 questions at the same speed. If Mark took 8 hours to complete his first test and 6 hours to complete his second test, how many questions did he not solve?
The candy machine contains four times as many pink gumballs as there are blue gumballs. If there are 12 blue gumballs, how many pink ones are there?
Of the 20 cars available for rent, 12 are automatic, four are manual, and the rest are semi-automatic. What percentage is semi-automatic?
There are 700 bees in a beehive. There are 12 times as many worker bees as there are baby pots, and there are twice as many baby bees as there are queen bees. How many worker bees are there?

Jordan plays video games for two hours every day. He also has a part-time job where he earns $10 an hour. How much would Jordan earn per week if he replaced the time he spends playing games with a part-time job?
John buys milk for $2, eggs for $3, light bulbs for $3, cups for $3, and cockroach traps for $4. If non-food items are subject to a 10% tax, how much did everything cost?

Kim started a housekeeping business and calculated how much profit she could make from her customers. He already has three customers, but he is in talks with another five potential customers and is confident enough to include them in his calculations. Each customer's home requires two bottles of bleach and one pack of cloths to clean. Bleach bottles are $2 each and cloth packs are $5 each. These are his only expenses. He calculated that his total weekly income would be $92. Profit is the difference between total income and total expenses. How many dollars in profit will Lucas earn each week?
John has a 10 hectare pineapple farm. There are 100 pineapples per hectare. John can harvest pineapples every three months. How many pineapples can John harvest in a year?

Johnny is picking up toys on the floor of his room. On the floor, he overturned a Lego box containing 500 pieces, a box containing three times as many pieces as the 500 pieces, and a box containing 1/4 as many pieces. If he picks up all the Legos, how many blocks will he pick up in total?

Deborah monitors the bee hive to see how many bees come and go each day. During the first 6 hours, 30 bees leave the hive and one-half of them return within 6 hours. She saw twice as many bees fly out of the hive and leave over the next six hours as the first to leave the hive. Then, the bees that left earlier but have not yet returned return to the hive over the next six hours. How many bees does Deborah see returning to the hive in the last 6 hours of the day?

Brittany and her mother go to an art museum. Admission is $12 for adults and $10 for children. Brittany's mother paid the ticket price for one child and one adult to her accountant. If she received $8 in change, how much did she give to the person paying her bill?
Charlie has three times as many Facebook friends as Dorothy. James has four times as many Facebook friends as Dorothy. If Charlie has 12 Facebook friends, how many Facebook friends does James have?

Steve and Tim decided to decide who would get home from school first. Steve lives further away than Tim, so he can ride his bike. Steve lives three miles from school and can bike 440 feet in one minute. Tim lives two miles away from the school. If Tim can ride a skateboard and travel 264 feet in one minute, how long will the buyer have to wait for the loser to finish the race?

Shonda decided that the neighborhood kids could really use a bicycle pumping service. She decided it would be best to charge per tire. It costs 25 cents to inflate each tire. On the first day, five people came on bicycles to inflate both tires. The three of them came to inflate all the tires on the tricycle. In the end, one person was able to ride a unicycle. How much did she earn that day?
Carl buys 10 packs of cookies. Each pack contains 6 cookies. Each cookie costs $0.10. If Carl paid with a $10 bill, how much change would he receive back?

Dave bought a large pack of fries and ate 14 of them before a hungry seagull snatched the pack from his hand. The seagull landed on the ground and devoured half of Dave's french fries. Then three pigeons took the food from him and ate three potatoes each. Later, the raccoon stole two-thirds of the remaining potatoes. Ali brought in the last fries and there were five left. How many fries were in the pack when Dave bought it?

On Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays, Kimo, a college student, attends three one-hour lectures each day. On Tuesdays and Thursdays, he has two two-hour lectures each day. There are 16 weeks of school in a semester. How many hours does Kimo spend attending lectures in one semester?

Bill bakes 300 rolls, 120 chocolate croissants, and 60 baguettes each day. Each roll is 4 inches long, each croissant is 6 inches long, and each baguette is 2 feet long. If all of Bill's baked goods were lined up, how many feet would it be?

The zookeeper feeds all the monkeys in the zoo. He orders all his bananas from a local farm every two months. If a monkey needs 200 bananas, a gorilla needs 400 bananas, and a baboon needs 100 bananas every month, how many bananas should he ask for in two months?

Blake and Kelly are competing to see who can run the most in 15 minutes. They decide to race around a 100 yard long football field. Blake runs back and forth 15 times. Kelly went back and forth once, then decided he didn't want to run next to Blake, ran to the 40-yard line, and ran back. She did this 34 times. How much longer did the winners run than the losers?
Rafael went out to buy school supplies. He bought four pens that cost $1.50 each, two notebooks that cost $4 each, and a side of bond paper that cost $20. How much did Raphael spend in total?

Finn is watching 11 tadpoles swimming in a pond. Suddenly six of them came out from under the lily pads, and then I saw two of them hiding under a rock. How many tadpoles does Finn see in the pond now?
The water tank was 17 feet deep on Monday. On Tuesday, the tank had gained 7 feet of water. On Wednesday, the water was two-thirds as deep as Tuesday. How deep is the water in the tank on Wednesday?

Anakin and Locsin went to the beach today. Anakin caught 10 starfish, 6 seahorses, and 3 clownfish. Meanwhile, Locsin caught five fewer starfish, three fewer seahorses, and two more clownfish than Anakin. How many fish did they catch?
A bag of marbles costs $20, and the price increases every two months by 20% of the original price. How much will a bag of marbles be worth after 36 months?

There are various toys in the room: 5 red cars, 3 action figures, and 1 doll. The dolls cost the same as three action figures, and one red car costs $4. If action figures cost $5, how much are all the toys worth?

Jackie is trying to decide whether to handle her taxes herself or hire an accountant. If she did it herself, she would reduce her freelance work by 3 hours and lose $35 an hour in lost income. An accountant costs $90. How much more can she earn if she hires an accountant?

Elvira chose a new computer as a gift for her 30th birthday, along with many accessories. She has a budget of 1500 euros donated by her entire family and she thinks she will be able to leave a little money for her clothes. She goes to a computer shop and chooses a machine that costs 1,090 euros including screen, keyboard and mouse. She also buys a scanner for 157 euros, a CD burner for 74 euros and a printer for 102 euros. How much will she have left on her clothing?

Sandra's neighbors give her a basket containing nine eggs every time she takes care of their daughter. To make Spanish flan, you need three eggs. If Sandra is tasked with making 15 Spanish flans for a school fundraiser, how many times will she have to look after the children?
Seth is twice older than Brooke. After two years, their combined age will be 28. How old is Seth?
Jimmy has $2 more than Ethal has, which is twice the amount he has. If Ethal has $8, how much does Jimmy have?
Pancho walks 20 miles a day. He walks 10 miles only on weekends. How many miles does he walk a week?

The marching band is ordering new uniforms. Each uniform consists of a $25 hat, a jacket that costs three times as much as the hat, and pants that cost the average price of the hat and jacket. How much will all the uniforms cost?
Jake is walking to the insect museum. He sees 80 eight-legged spiders, 90 six-legged insects, and rare mutant invertebrates with 10 legs each. How many legs does Jake see in total?

Caboose has four birds. Sally Two is three years older than Granny Red. Granny Red is twice as old as Sally Four. If Sally Four is the same age as Sally Thirty-Two, and Sally Thirty-Two is 8 years old, what is the total age of the four birds?

Jessica is trying to calculate how much debt she should pay each month. Her student loan has a minimum monthly payment of $300, her credit card has a monthly payment of $200, and her real estate loan has a minimum monthly payment of $500. If Jessica wants to pay 50% more than the minimum amount, how much will she pay per year?

Billy is peeling and cutting potatoes to prepare potato salad for a family barbecue. Since it's a big event, we need to prepare 60 potatoes. Because the potatoes are about the same size, it takes the same amount of time to peel and cut each potato. It takes Billy 1.5 minutes to peel one potato, but it only takes 5 seconds to cut it. How long does it take for Billy to prepare the potatoes?

Juan and his brother Carlos sell lemonade. Each gallon consumes $3 of lemon and $2 of sugar. It sells for $0.50 per cup and makes 20 cups per gallon. If you made $25, how much did you spend on lemons?
Of the 240 people of Asian descent, 80 were Japanese and the rest were Chinese. If the number of boys on the Chinese team is 60, how many girls are on the Chinese team?

Zeid spends a quarter of his salary on rent, a third on fuel for his car, and the other half he donates to his favorite charities. He gives his daughter $200 for weekly expenses and his wife $700 for groceries and household items. If Zeid earns $6,000 a month, how much is left after these expenses and donations?
Lani has 10 more crabs than Monique, who has 4 fewer crabs than Beau. If Beau has 40 crabs, how many crabs do the three of them have in total?
Lloyd is a math teacher and earns $10 an hour. He taught 5 hours his first week and 8 hours the next week. How much did he earn in the first two weeks?

Two people are running for class president at Sarai's school. If the winner took 3/4 of the votes, and the total number of students voting in the class was 80, calculate the number of heads taken by the loser.

Sandra, the corner florist, is very unhappy about Fred's undelivered orders. Sandra had ordered four times as many red roses as white carnations. She also ordered 200 pink calla lilies, five times as many as white canations. Sandra threatened that she would change her supplier if she could not deliver the red roses by 5pm. How many red roses must Fred prepare by 5 p.m. to keep Sandra as her business partner?
Jane is two years older than Mark. Two years ago, Mark was five years older than Jean, who was half his age. If Jean is 30 years old, how old is Jane?

Two track and field teams are competing in the 1600 meter relay. It is a competition in which four people per team each run 400 meters, or one standard lap around a track. A team of equal ability can each run 400 meters in exactly 55 seconds. The other team has some variation in ability, with the first runner finishing the race in 60 seconds, and each subsequent runner running three seconds faster than the previous runner. Based on this information, by how many seconds will the winning team win?
Jerry is rolling a six-sided die. Is the probability that he will roll a number greater than 3 higher (by what percentage) than the probability that he will roll an even number twice in a row?
Jenna and her mother picked some apples from the apple farm. Jenna picked half as many as her mother. If her mother picked 20 apples, how many apples did she pick together?

Russell works at a pet store and is trying to feed straw to rodents. Each of the three cages had an equal number of rats, and each rat was given six straws. Apart from that, there are 10 cages each containing one hamster, and each hamster is given five straws. Apart from that, there is a rabbit hutch and 20 straws are given to all the rabbits. Straw is not used for any other purpose at this pet shop. If the rodents were given a total of 160 straws, how many rats were in each cage?
Mandy owes Benedict $100. They agreed to earn 2% interest monthly. Assuming that Mandy can repay the loan in 3 months, how much should she pay Benedict?

A merchant bought several bags of wheat from a farm for $20 each. If it costs him $2 to transport a bag of wheat from the farm to the warehouse, and if the merchant earns $400 by selling each bag of wheat for $30, how many bags of wheat does the merchant sell? Will it happen?

Three friends bought three tickets to a traveling amusement park for $20.25. I bought the food for $4.50 less than the ticket. We rode two rides that cost $33 per ride. How much did each person spend if they decided to divide all expenses equally?
John picks peaches for three hours. He can harvest two peaches in one minute. How many peaches will he harvest?
Ducks need to eat 3.5 pounds of insects each week to survive. If you have a flock of 10 ducks, how many pounds of insects will they need per day?
Tom plants 10 trees a year. Every year he cuts down two trees a year. He starts with 50 trees. After 10 years, 30% of trees will die. How many trees will he have left?

Sue lives in a pleasant neighborhood. One weekend, the neighbors decided to play a prank on Sue. On Friday morning, neighbors placed 18 plastic pink flamingos in Sue's front yard. On Saturday morning, the neighbors removed one-third of the flamingo, painted it white, and returned the newly painted white flamingo to Sue's front garden. Then, on Sunday morning, they added another 18 plastic pink flamingos to the collection. How many more plastic pink flamingos than plastic white flamingos on Sunday afternoon?
Violetta would like to buy new crayons. She needs 5 different colors and she set aside $20 for this purchase. One crayon costs $2. How much will her change be?
A pen costs the same as a pencil and eraser combined. Pencils are $1.20 and erasers are $0.30. How much does 8 pens cost?
In one town, 200 pounds of carrots are about to be distributed to 40 restaurants. Each restaurant will receive two pounds of carrots. How many pounds of carrots remain undistributed?
Soda City has 23,786 residents. This includes 8,417 men and 9,092 women. The remainder of the population is children. How many children are there in Soda City?

Elaine started out with 20 Pokemon cards. A month later, she had collected three times as many new cards. In the second month, I collected 20 fewer cards than in the first month. In the third month, she collected twice as many Pokemon cards as she collected in the first and second months combined. How many Pokémon cards does Elaine have now?

Mark is the editor. I edit the same number of sentences each week for two publishers, and each publisher pays a different amount per sentence. Publisher B pays twice as much as Publisher A. Mark edits a total of 1,000 sentences each week, and Publisher A pays him 5 cents per sentence. How many cents does Mark receive each week?
Balder gets water from the well. He gets 5 tubs of water every morning and 6 tubs of water every afternoon. If each pail contains 5 liters of water, how many liters of water does he get each day?

John won an award for his work. The award comes with a one-time payment of $5,000 and a 5% increase in salary. If John earned $2,000 each week throughout the year and he received this award on the first day of the year, how much did John receive that year?
Josey grows grapes on a 10-acre farm. Each acre can produce 5 tons of grapes each year. One ton of grapes can produce two barrels of wine. How many barrels of wine can her farm produce each year?

Karl's favorite food is cheese. He ate sandwiches for lunch every day this week and used two slices of cheese on each sandwich. For three days that week, he had a cheese and egg omelet for breakfast, using one more slice of cheese in each omelet than in the sandwich. On some days that week, he continued to eat a large plate of macaroni and cheese, which used 8 slices of cheese. How many slices of cheese did you use in total?

Janet has 22 green pens and 10 yellow pens. Then she bought 6 bags of blue pens and 2 bags of red pens. She had nine pens in each bag of blue pens and six pens in each bag of red pens. How many pens does Janet have now?

Brinley is taking Mr. Bart's math class. Mr. Bart gives tests six times each semester. He allows students to remove their lowest score each semester from their average score. If Brinley scores 89, 71, 92, 100, and 86 on her first five tests, how many points does she need to score on her sixth test to get an average of 93? do you have?

Michael loves riding bicycles. He rides at least five times a week, covering 25 kilometers each time. He did it for 4 weeks and then decided to ride only twice a week but 60 km each time, which he continued for 3 weeks. How many kilometers did Michael run in total?

Joe's Halloween candy bag contains 25 chocolate bars and 80 candy apples. Each chocolate bar is twice the weight of a candy apple. If each chocolate bar weighs 40 grams, how many grams does Joe's bag of candy weigh?

Rose went to the store on Monday and bought four cakes. On Tuesday, she went to a different store and bought three times as many cakes. On Wednesday, she went to another store and bought five times as many cakes as she had bought on Tuesday. How many cakes did you buy in 3 days?
Twenty dozen cups cost $1200 less than the total cost of half a dozen plates, which sell for $6000. Calculate the total cost of purchasing each cup.

Sarah went to buy a new jacket and two pairs of shoes for herself. The jacket she wanted cost $30, and each pair of her shoes cost $20. Sarah took care of her neighbor's children four times and earned $5 each. Her parents give her $4 every time she mows the lawn. If Sarah has already saved $10 before she starts caring for her child, how many times does she have to mow the lawn to afford a jacket and shoes?

Jerry owns a flock of chickens. Red hens lay three eggs a day, white hens lay five eggs a day. Jerry collects 42 eggs every day. If he has two more white chickens than red chickens, how many red chickens are there?
Gerry likes to walk along the edges of local parks, which are 1.5 mile and 6 mile rectangles. If he walks 3 miles an hour, how many hours does he spend walking?

At the dollar store, Stone counted 100 customers walking in. The next day, she counted 50 more customers coming in than the first day. If the total number of customers on the third day was 500, how many customers came in on the third day?

Jerry has two pools, both of which have leaks, producing 4 gallons of water per minute. Four minutes ago, the large pool contained twice as much water as the small pool. Now, a large pool holds four times as much water as a small pool. How much water is in the small pool now?
Laurie wants to buy shoes that cost $320 and a matching belt that costs $32. She works part-time and earns $8 an hour. How many hours will she have to work before she can shop?
Janez borrowed $2,000 and promised to pay it back with 10% more. If you pay $165 a month for 12 months, how much will you owe after 12 months?
There are four roses in the vase. There are seven more dahlias than roses in the vase. How many flowers are in the vase in total?
Adrian is three times Harriet's age, and Harriet is half Zach's age. If Harriet is 21 years old now, what will be the average age of the three children in three years?

The four students earned a total of 251 points in the board game. Naomi got 68 points. Yuri scored 10 more points than half of what Naomi got, and Brianna got 17 more points than Naomi. How many points did Jojo get?

Carmen takes 10 minutes to solve a crossword puzzle and 5 minutes to solve a Sudoku puzzle. Over the weekend, we did 3 crossword puzzles and 8 Sudoku puzzles. How much time did she spend on these puzzles?

A tank contains 120 liters of water. Celine used 90 liters of water from the aquarium to water her small garden. She was then able to collect twice as much rainwater as the amount of water left. How much water is in the aquarium?
Andy plants 90 geraniums and 40 fewer petunias than geraniums. How much does he plant in total?
A company spent $15,000 on advertising in one year and spent one-third of that amount the next year. What is the total advertising expense paid by the company over two years?

Carlos and Benji are on the beach. Carlos rented a canoe for $30 an hour and Benji rented a banana boat for $18 an hour. If Carlos uses the canoe for 3 hours and Benji uses the boat for 5 hours, what is the total rental fee they will pay?

Andrew is planning a road trip from New Jersey to Rochester. Traveling by bus takes six days; traveling by car takes half that time. How many days would it take to take a bus to Rochester and drive back to New Jersey?

James is counting Pokemon cards. He has 30 fire type cards, 20 grass type cards, and 40 water type cards. If he loses 8 water-type cards and buys 14 grass-type cards, what is the probability that the card he randomly chooses will be water-type (rounded to the nearest whole number)?

Chad ordered a build-your-own burrito for lunch. A basic burrito costs $6.50. Order additional meat for $2.00, additional cheese for $1.00, avocado for $1.00, and two sauces for $0.25. He upgraded his lunch for an additional $3.00 and included chips and a drink. He has a $5.00 gift card to use at checkout. How much will his fee be now?
Kalinda is working on a 360-piece puzzle with her mother. Kalinda can fit 4 pieces per minute. Mothers can wear half as many Kalindas. How many hours will it take to complete this puzzle?

A watermelon farm grew 120 small-fruited watermelons. When Ashlyn visited the farm two months later, 30% of the watermelons were ready for harvest, so she took them home. When she returned two weeks later, three-quarters of the remaining watermelons were ready for harvest, so she cut them down. How many watermelons were not ready for harvest at that time?
Mark bought 12 cars for his company. The cars cost $20,000 each. Mark paid 10% tax on the car and paid $1,000 per car for his registration. How much did you pay in total?

Kylie and Robert like collecting seashells on the beach. On Monday, Kylie collected 5 more shells than Robert, and Robert collected 20 shells. On Tuesday, Kylie collected twice as many shells as on Monday. How many shells did Kylie collect on Tuesday?
Dax goes to the field to pick apples and notices that there are half as many insects in the garden as there are ants. If there are 50 ants, how many insects are there in total in the field?
36 penguins are sunbathing in the snow. One-third of them crawl into the water and begin swimming. Another third goes into caves to feed. How many penguins are still sunbathing?

Steve is determined to eat more tomatoes and decides to start growing his own cherry tomatoes. He eats twice as many tomatoes as his girlfriend. He eats 6 tomatoes per day. How many vines does Steve need if he can produce 3 tomatoes per week from one vine?
John ordered pizza with his friend. I have a total of 20 friends and I want each person to be able to eat 4 slices. Each pizza slice has 8 slices. How many pizzas should John order?

Ram uses a lot of pens. He realized that he could save money by collecting the ink from five empty pens and making one pen. If you buy 25 pens and when you run out of ink, collect them to make one pen, how many pens will you have in total?
After adding $10 to his $20 allowance, Johnny invested this money and tripled it in one year. How much money did Johnny have after one year?
Mary is two years younger than Joan, and Joan is five years older than Jessa. If Jessa is 20 years old, what is the total age of the three people?

There were 1,000 students in the school auditorium. The auditorium had three entrances and exits: A, B, and C. If 30% of students exit from Entrance A, three-fifths of the remaining students exit from Entrance B, and the remaining students exit from Entrance C, how many students exit from Entrance C? Please calculate it.
James has 6 more candies than Robert. John has twice as many candies as Robert. If John has 54 candies, how many more candies does John have than James?
Dolly has two books. I have one copy of Pandora. If Dory and Pandora read each other's books in addition to their own, how many books would they have read together?

Mike has five pen pals. I stopped corresponding with two of them. Each pen pal will send you two letters each consisting of five pages per week. Mike replies in the same vein. Mike can write in 6 minutes per sheet. How many hours per week do you spend writing letters?

Jason is on a contract plan that allows him to talk for 1,000 minutes per month. He calls his boss for 15 minutes every day and everyone else for 300 minutes this month. If this month ends on the 30th, how many more minutes of calls can I make this month?

Griffin had 24 fries, and Kyle took five of them. Billy took twice as many as Kyle. Ginger gave some to Griffin, but Colby took three fewer fries from Griffin than Kyle. If Griffin ended up with 27 fries, how many did Ginger give him?

There are four snails in an aquarium. Another aquarium has 32 snails. The difference between the two is twice the total number of fish in both aquariums. If each aquarium has the same number of fish, how many fish are in each aquarium?

Gene is charged $250 an hour by a makeup artist. The movies I'm starring in require expensive make-up, which takes six hours each time, and I have to do it four times a week. The movie finished in five weeks. After the movie was completed, the make-up artist gave Gene a 10% discount since the payment was too large. How much did Gene pay?

Isabel bought party supplies for her sister's birthday party. She spent $12 on cake supplies, $43 on her birthday present, $15 on decorations, $4 on invitation cards, and $22 on souvenir bags for guests attending the party. She splits her expenses equally between her two parents and her expenses. How many dollars did you pay for each?
The chef bought four bags of onions. Each weighs 50 pounds. A pound of onions costs $1.50. How much did the chef spend?

On Monday, Sue ate as many cookies as her sister. On Tuesday, she ate twice as many cookies as her sister. Her sister ate 5 cookies on Monday and 13 cookies the next day. If one cookie has 200 calories, how many more calories did Sue get compared to her sister?
